options.text: Require when specified on the data source

fields.label_tooltip:
This field determines if/when authentication would be required to access content and also influences what configuration fields are available for the plugin.

If “Require when specified on the data source” is selected, then the feeds delivered by the data source provider must identify relevant content as requiring authentication.

When this field is on, the plugin will check if content requires payment (an entitlement or purchasable product) when given content is triggered.

This field also influences what configuration fields are available for the plugin.
If switched on, the plugin UI will be launched when the user launches the app, unless the device is already authorized to access the app.

Determine whether to present storefront upon app launch after authentication.

If switched off, only sign-up/login will be required for app-level access.

Enter here, in a comma-separated list, the product ids specified by the service provider for any entitlements which provide users access to the home screen of the app.

At least one value must be provided in order to present the storefront screen upon launch.

When the authentication process begins, this field determines what to present first.

By selecting “Login”, the plugin will prompt login first, with an option to switch to the sign-up screen in case the user does not have an account.

By selecting “Sign-Up”, the plugin will present the user with the sign-up (aka registration) screen first, with an option to switch to login in case the user already has an account.

Please upload a JSON file with a section for the sign-up and login screens, with each section containing the expected input fields for the given screen. Please follow the format and guidance outlined in the example file [here](https://example.com)
The text of an alert explaining there is an issue when the user is not able to move forward and specific error messaging is not applicable.
fields.initial_value: An error occurred trying to process your request. Please go back and try again.

fields.label_tooltip:
The text that will be displayed in the alert message presented when the user tries to access content and has a relevant voucher which has expired.

This will lead to the payment options screen
fields.initial_value: The applicable purchase you’ve made has expired. Please make a valid purchase to access this content.

fields.label: Prompt Text
fields.tooltip: These fields will determine the font used in the prompt prior to the link in various scenarios

fields.label_tooltip:
One screen may present an option to lead to another screen or action. For example, on the login screen, the text “Don’t have an account?” may appear before a link which leads to the sign-up screen.

This field will determine the font used in the prompt prior to the link for such scenarios.

One screen may present an option to lead to another screen or action. For example, on the login screen, the text “Don’t have an account?” may appear before a link which leads to the sign-up screen.

This field will determine the font used in the prompt prior to the link for such scenarios.

One screen may present an option to lead to another screen or action. For example, on the login screen, the text “Don’t have an account?” may appear before a link which leads to the sign-up screen.

This field will determine the font-size used in the prompt prior to the link for such scenarios.

This field will determine the font-size used in the prompt prior to the link for such scenarios.

This field will determine the font-color used in the prompt prior to the link for such scenarios.

fields.label_tooltip: One screen may present an option to lead to another screen or action. For example, on the login screen, the text “Sign Up” may be lead to the sign-up screen when tapped. This field will determine the font used for such linkable text in the gateway screens.

One screen may present an option to lead to another screen or action. For example, on the login screen, the text “Sign Up” may be lead to the sign-up screen when tapped. This field will determine the font used for such linkable text in the gateway screens.

One screen may present an option to lead to another screen or action. For example, on the login screen, the text “Sign Up” may be lead to the sign-up screen when tapped. This field will determine the font-size used for such linkable text in the gateway screens.

Determine whether to offer alternative methods of authentication outside of the custom form determined by the custom “Authentication Input Fields” configuration field.

If this field is switched on, whatever alternative authentication options that are supported (e.g. Facebook, Apple) will be offered as an option to the end-users.

Checking this field sets alternative authentication as higher priority than the custom form and will present these options above the custom form.

Which option to take depends on your priorities - having the alternative logins at the top of the screen may make conversion more likely but will also lead to the collection of the data the third party uses rather than the data specified by your custom form.

For design purposes, we recommend switching this field on if the custom form includes more than three fields.

There is a design separating the standard login/sign-up form from alternative options, with text in the middle of the design.

Depending on the main language of the app, we recommend putting a version of the word “Or” here to distinguish between the two modes of authentication.

If you supported in-app purchases before SSO/login, you may want to notify users that they can restore old purchases on the storefront screen once they authenticate. This field provides a message for users to understand this.

This field is left blank by default, but an example message would be “If you’ve already made a purchase, you will be able to restore that purchase at no cost once you’ve logged in.”

If left blank, no such message will be presented. If this is not a relevant use-case for you, it would be better to keep blank to keep the design and UX as clean as possible.
Various screens include an email input. This field determines The text that will be displayed in an in-screen error alert bubble when a user doesn’t provide a valid email address.
fields.initial_value: Please enter a valid email address

fields.label_tooltip: Various screens include manual input fields. If a required field is not populated, the user will not be able to proceed to the next screen. This field provides the text the user will see when clicking on the error icon for the given field.

Given login via Facebook is supported, this field provides the text that will be displayed in the alert message presented when the user tries to login or sign up via Facebook and does not provide the Facebook app permissions to share email information.
fields.initial_value: Please provide Facebook permission to share email information in order to login with Facebook.

The text that will appear before the price of a payment option in the button of a payment option card. A space character will be automatically placed between this field and the price value.

For example, if the price of an item is $3.99 and this field is defaulted to “Subscribe for”, then the button will read “Subscribe for $3.99
The legal text presented at the bottom of the payment option screen. Used only on iOS.
fields.initial_value: Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase. Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal. Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase.Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.
